result.markdown:
---
title: "More text parsing"
format: revealjs
---

# Regular expressions

::: {.cell execution_count=1}
``` {.python .cell-code}
import re
```
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/tutorial.html)
:::

## Vocabulary

regex / regular expression
:    a pattern describing a certain amount of text.

match
:    piece of text or sequence of bytes/characters that a pattern corresponds to.

string
:    sequence of characters that the regular expression is applied to.

> We try to get a **match** of a **regex** in a **string**.

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/tutorial.html)
:::

## Regular expression object

`re.compile(regex[, flags])` → `re.Pattern` object. Useful if you want to use the same pattern multiple times.

::: {.cell execution_count=2}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email_regex = r'\b(?P<username>[a-z0-9_.]+)@(?P<domain>[a-z0-9.-]+\.[a-z]{2,4})\b'
pattern = re.compile(email_regex, re.I)
type(pattern)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4505}
```
re.Pattern
```
:::
:::


. . .

::: {.cell execution_count=3}
``` {.python .cell-code}
pattern.pattern
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4506}
```
'\\b(?P<username>[a-z0-9_.]+)@(?P<domain>[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z]{2,4})\\b'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=4}
``` {.python .cell-code}
pattern.groups
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4507}
```
2
```
:::
:::


## Match object

Output of `re.search()`, `re.match()`, `re.fullmatch()` and the `search()`, `match()` and `fullmatch()` methods of a `re.Pattern` object.

::: {.cell execution_count=5}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email = pattern.search('My email is mariana.montes@kuleuven.be')
email
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4508}
```
<re.Match object; span=(12, 38), match='mariana.montes@kuleuven.be'>
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=6}
``` {.python .cell-code}
astring = re.search(r'[a-z]+\.$', 'Here is my email.')
astring
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4509}
```
<re.Match object; span=(11, 17), match='email.'>
```
:::
:::


## Match object: components

::: {.cell execution_count=7}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.re
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4510}
```
re.compile(r'\b(?P<username>[a-z0-9_.]+)@(?P<domain>[a-z0-9.-]+\.[a-z]{2,4})\b',
           re.IGNORECASE|re.UNICODE)
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=8}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.string
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4511}
```
'My email is mariana.montes@kuleuven.be'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=9}
``` {.python .cell-code}
astring.re
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4512}
```
re.compile(r'[a-z]+\.$', re.UNICODE)
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=10}
``` {.python .cell-code}
astring.string
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4513}
```
'Here is my email.'
```
:::
:::


. . .

::: {.cell execution_count=11}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.expand(r'The username is \g<username> and the domain is \2.')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4514}
```
'The username is mariana.montes and the domain is kuleuven.be.'
```
:::
:::


## Match object: matches

::: {.cell execution_count=12}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.group()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4515}
```
'mariana.montes@kuleuven.be'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=13}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.groups()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4516}
```
('mariana.montes', 'kuleuven.be')
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=14}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.group('username')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4517}
```
'mariana.montes'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=15}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.group(1)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4518}
```
'mariana.montes'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=16}
``` {.python .cell-code}
astring.group()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4519}
```
'email.'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=17}
``` {.python .cell-code}
astring.groups()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4520}
```
()
```
:::
:::


## Match object: indices

::: {.cell execution_count=18}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.span()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4521}
```
(12, 38)
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=19}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.string[email.start():email.end()]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4522}
```
'mariana.montes@kuleuven.be'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=20}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.string[:email.start()]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4523}
```
'My email is '
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=21}
``` {.python .cell-code}
astring.span()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4524}
```
(11, 17)
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=22}
``` {.python .cell-code}
astring.string[email.start():email.end()]
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4525}
```
'mail.'
```
:::
:::


## Special characters

`\`, `^`, `$`, `.`, `|`, `?`, `*`, `+`, `(`, `)`, `[`, `{`.

- Special meaning

- If used where they shouldn't (e.g. `+` at the beginning): error

- Used literally if escaped with `\`. Combining `\` with another character may result in a special meaning.

- `]` is literal always unless you already used `[` and didn't close it yet.

## Escaping and quotes

- Quotation marks may have to be escaped if they match the ones you use to surround your regex.

- Recommended to use raw strings to avoid escaping too much:

::: {.cell execution_count=23}
``` {.python .cell-code}
short_string = r"a one line raw string"
short_string
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4526}
```
'a one line raw string'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=24}
``` {.python .cell-code}
long_string = r"""a raw string
with
many lines
"""
long_string
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4527}
```
'a raw string\nwith\nmany lines\n'
```
:::
:::


## Non-printable characters

::: div

- `\t` = tab
- `\r` = carriage return
- `\n` = line feed

:::

:::: columns

::: column

::: {.cell execution_count=25}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print(short_string)
re.findall(r'\n', short_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
a one line raw string
```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4528}
```
[]
```
:::
:::


:::

::: column

::: {.cell execution_count=26}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print(long_string)
re.findall(r'\n', long_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
a raw string
with
many lines

```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4529}
```
['\n', '\n', '\n']
```
:::
:::


:::
::::

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/nonprint.html)
:::

## Character classes

- Match one out of several characters by placing them between `[]`.

- Negate the match by starting with `^`. It can also match line break characters. It has to match _something_.

. . .

::: callout-note
### Example

::: {.cell execution_count=27}
``` {.python .cell-code}
pattern.pattern
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4530}
```
'\\b(?P<username>[a-z0-9_.]+)@(?P<domain>[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z]{2,4})\\b'
```
:::
:::


- `[a-z0-9_.]` matches any lowercase letter, digit, `_` or `.`

- `[a-z]` only matches lowercase letters.

:::

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/charclass.html)
:::

## Character classes

- Only special characters inside are `]`, `\`, `^` , `-`. They can be escaped with a backslash or by changing the position so they don't take their special meaning.

- A `?`, `*` or `+` afterwards matches the character _class_, not the matched character (see Backreferences).

::: callout-note
### Example

- `[a-z0-9_.]+` matches any _combination_ of one or more lowercase letters, digits, `_` or `.`.

- `[a-z]+` matches one or more lowecase letters, not necessarily the same letter repeated.
:::

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/charclass.html)
:::

## Shorthand character classes: digits

::: {.cell execution_count=28}
``` {.python .cell-code}
test_string = """A string (test_string) with 3 numbers:
1, 2 and the one-mentioned-before."""
```
:::


- `\d` = `[0-9]` (but also other scripts). `\D` is the opposite.

::: {.cell execution_count=29}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.findall(r'\d+', test_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4532}
```
['3', '1', '2']
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=30}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.findall(r'\D+', test_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4533}
```
['A string (test_string) with ',
 ' numbers:\n',
 ', ',
 ' and the one-mentioned-before.']
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/shorthand.html)
:::

## Shorthand character classes: words

- `\w` = `[A-Za-z0-9_]`. `\W` is the opposite.

::: {.cell execution_count=31}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print(re.findall(r'\w+', test_string))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
['A', 'string', 'test_string', 'with', '3', 'numbers', '1', '2', 'and', 'the', 'one', 'mentioned', 'before']
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=32}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.findall(r'\W+', test_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4535}
```
[' ', ' (', ') ', ' ', ' ', ':\n', ', ', ' ', ' ', ' ', '-', '-', '.']
```
:::
:::


. . .

- It matches other scripts too:

::: {.cell execution_count=33}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.findall('\w+', '言葉 means "word".')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4536}
```
['言葉', 'means', 'word']
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/shorthand.html)
:::

## Shorthand character classes: spaces

::: {.cell execution_count=34}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print(test_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
A string (test_string) with 3 numbers:
1, 2 and the one-mentioned-before.
```
:::
:::


- `\s` = `[ \t\r\n\f]` (`\f` = form feed). `\S` is the opposite.

::: {.cell execution_count=35}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.findall(r'\s+', test_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4538}
```
[' ', ' ', ' ', ' ', ' ', '\n', ' ', ' ', ' ', ' ']
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=36}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print(re.findall(r'\S+', test_string))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
['A', 'string', '(test_string)', 'with', '3', 'numbers:', '1,', '2', 'and', 'the', 'one-mentioned-before.']
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/shorthand.html)
:::

## Shorthand character classes

::: {.cell execution_count=37}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print(test_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
A string (test_string) with 3 numbers:
1, 2 and the one-mentioned-before.
```
:::
:::


- They can also be used inside brackets.

::: {.cell execution_count=38}
``` {.python .cell-code}
# any sequence of digits + spaces
re.findall(r'[\d\s]+', test_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4541}
```
[' ', ' ', ' ', ' 3 ', '\n1', ' 2 ', ' ', ' ']
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/shorthand.html)
:::

## Dot

- Matches anything except for line breaks (unless `re.S` flag is used).

- Use sparingly: it can match things you don't want to match! Sometimes a negated character class is better.

::: {.cell execution_count=39}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.search('(.+)@', 'mariana.montes@kuleuven.be or anothermail@gmail.com').groups()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4542}
```
('mariana.montes@kuleuven.be or anothermail',)
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=40}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.search('([^@]+)@', 'mariana.montes@kuleuven.be or anothermail@gmail.com').groups()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4543}
```
('mariana.montes',)
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/dot.html)
:::

## Anchors

- Does not match a character but a position

- `^` = beginning of a line

- `$` = end of a lne

- `\b` = word boundaries: between something that matches `\w` and beginning/end of the string or something that matches `\W`.

::: callout-note
### Example

::: {.cell execution_count=41}
``` {.python .cell-code}
pattern.pattern
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4544}
```
'\\b(?P<username>[a-z0-9_.]+)@(?P<domain>[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z]{2,4})\\b'
```
:::
:::


:::

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/anchors.html)
:::

## Alternation

`|` to match either one sequence or another.

::: {.cell execution_count=42}
``` {.python .cell-code}
print(long_string)
re.findall('(string|lines)', long_string)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
a raw string
with
many lines

```
:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4545}
```
['string', 'lines']
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/alternation.html)
:::

## Repetition

- `{0,1}` = `?` = zero or one times
- `{0,}` = `*` = zero or more times
- `{1,}` = `+` = one or more times
- `{x}` = repeat exactly `x` times

::: callout-tip
 `?` after one of this makes the search lazy instead of greedy. A negated character class is more efficient, though.
:::

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/repeat.html)
:::

## Repetition

::: {.cell execution_count=43}
``` {.python .cell-code}
pattern.pattern
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4546}
```
'\\b(?P<username>[a-z0-9_.]+)@(?P<domain>[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z]{2,4})\\b'
```
:::
:::


- `[a-zO-9_.]+` = _at least one_ lower case letter, digit, underscore or period.
- `[a-z]{2,4}` = _two to four_ lower case letters.

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/repeat.html)
:::

## Grouping and capturing

Done with `()`:

- to apply a quantifier or limit an alternation
- creates a numbered group unless it starts with `?:` (non-capturing group)
- creates a named group if it starts with `?P<name>`

::: callout-note
### Example

::: {.cell execution_count=44}
``` {.python .cell-code}
pattern.pattern
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4547}
```
'\\b(?P<username>[a-z0-9_.]+)@(?P<domain>[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z]{2,4})\\b'
```
:::
:::


:::

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/brackets.html)
:::

## Backreferences

To match the same text again

- `\1` for the first capturing group, `\2` for the second... (non-capturing groups are excluded)

::: {.cell execution_count=45}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.re.pattern
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4548}
```
'\\b(?P<username>[a-z0-9_.]+)@(?P<domain>[a-z0-9.-]+\\.[a-z]{2,4})\\b'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=46}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.string
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4549}
```
'My email is mariana.montes@kuleuven.be'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=47}
``` {.python .cell-code}
email.expand(r'The username is \1 and the domain is \2.')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4550}
```
'The username is mariana.montes and the domain is kuleuven.be.'
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/backref.html)
:::

## Backreferences

There is a difference between `[ab]+` and `(a|b)\1+`:

::: {.cell execution_count=48}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.search(r'[ab]+', "abby").group()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4551}
```
'abb'
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=49}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.search(r'(a|b)\1+', "abby").group()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4552}
```
'bb'
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/backref.html)
:::

## Backreferences for replacement

::: {.cell execution_count=50}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.sub(
    '([a-z]+)@([A-Za-z]+.com)', # regex
    r'The username is \1 and the domain is \2.', # replacement
    'lowercase@UpperCase.com', #string
    )
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4553}
```
'The username is lowercase and the domain is UpperCase.com.'
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/backref.html)
:::

## Free spacing and comments

- Allow to use spaces between "logical sections".

- Add comments with `#`.

- With the `re.X` flag.

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/freespacing.html) - [re.X](https://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html#re.X)
:::

## Free spacing and comments

::: {.cell execution_count=51}
``` {.python .cell-code}
pat = re.compile(
    r"""\b               # word boundary
        (?P<username>    # username group
        [a-z0-9_.] +     # one or more lowercase/digits/underscore/period
        )
        @                # at symbol
        (?P<domain>      # domain group
        [a-z0-9.-] +     # one or more lowercase/digits/period/dash
        \.               # a literal period
        [a-z]     {2,4}  # two to four lowercase letters
        )
        \b               # word boundary""", re.X)
pat.search('mariana.montes@kuleuven.be').groups()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4554}
```
('mariana.montes', 'kuleuven.be')
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/freespacing.html) - [re.X](https://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html#re.X)
:::

## Mode modifiers

- Case insensitive (`i`) and free-spacing + comments (`x`)

::: {.cell execution_count=52}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.search(r'(?xi) [a-z] +', 'AaBbCc')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4555}
```
<re.Match object; span=(0, 6), match='AaBbCc'>
```
:::
:::


::: {.cell execution_count=53}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.compile(r'  [a-z] +  ', re.I | re.X).search('AaBbCc')
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4556}
```
<re.Match object; span=(0, 6), match='AaBbCc'>
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/modifiers.html) - [`re.compile()`](https://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html#re.compile)
:::

## Mode modifiers: multilinear

::: {.cell execution_count=54}
``` {.python .cell-code}
alliter = """apple
banana
melon
milk
"""
re.search(r'(?m)^a[a-z]+$', alliter)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4557}
```
<re.Match object; span=(0, 5), match='apple'>
```
:::
:::


. . .

::: {.cell execution_count=55}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.compile(r'^b[a-z]+$', re.M).search(alliter)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4558}
```
<re.Match object; span=(6, 12), match='banana'>
```
:::
:::


. . .

::: {.cell execution_count=56}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.search(r'^a[a-z]+$', alliter)
```
:::


. . .

::: {.cell execution_count=57}
``` {.python .cell-code}
re.search(r'^a[a-z\n]+$', alliter)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=4560}
```
<re.Match object; span=(0, 24), match='apple\nbanana\nmelon\nmilk\n'>
```
:::
:::


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/modifiers.html) - [`re.compile()`](https://docs.python.org/2/library/re.html#re.compile)
:::

## Lookaround

- Don't return matches but whether a match is made or not.

- Not capturing groups (but can have groups inside if you want to capture).

- Options: lookahead (`(?...)`) or lookbehind (`(?<...)`).

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/lookaround.html)
:::

## Lookahead

+ `q(?!u)` matches a 'q' that is NOT followed by an 'u'.
+ `q(?=u)` matches a 'q' followed by an 'u' but not the 'u' itself.
    - `q(?=u)i` can never match anything!
    - Can be very useful to find a match with *n* characters, e.g. `\b(?=\w{6}\b)\w*cat\w*` matches a word with exactly 6 characters that contains the pattern _cat_.

::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/lookaround.html)
:::

## Lookbehind

- No quantifiers or backreferences, alternation only if they have the same length.

+ `(?<!a)b` matches a 'b' NOT preceded by an 'a'
+ `(?<=a)b` matches a 'b' preceded by an 'a', but not the 'a'.


::: footer
[regular-expressions.info](https://www.regular-expressions.info/lookaround.html)
:::
